meanings.definition: To recover from illness or exertion.
meanings.sent1: After being sick for a week, she finally recuperates and feels better.
meanings.sent2: He always takes a nap after exercising to help his body recuperate.
meanings.sent3: The flu bug decided to take a vacation once she started to recuperate.
meanings.sent4: Her energy slowly recuperates like a wilting flower blooming again.
meanings.sent5: The medicine works like magic, helping her body recuperate quickly.

meanings.sent1: With proper rest, the athlete recuperates and gets back in shape.
meanings.sent2: The patient needs time to recuperate after the surgery to fully heal.
meanings.sent3: His muscles seem to throw a party when they start to recuperate.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to recuperate is like a flame that never goes out.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air and sunshine help him recuperate faster from his illness.

meanings.definition: To recover from financial loss or setback.
meanings.sent1: The company hopes to recuperate its losses by implementing new strategies.
meanings.sent2: After a tough year, the business slowly starts to recuperate financially.
meanings.sent3: The wallet seems to smile when it begins to recuperate from the shopping spree.
meanings.sent4: Her savings account recuperates like a phoenix rising from the ashes.
meanings.sent5: The investment finally starts to recuperate, bringing relief to the investor.
